    • Method Detail

      • canvas

        public static Image canvas(int width,
           int height,
           Color color)
        Returns a blank image filled with the specified color.

        The result is serializable.

        Parameters:
        width - the width of the canvas. Must be positive.
        height - the height of the canvas. Must be positive.
        color - the color to fill the canvas with
        See Also:
        canvas(int, int, Color, double)

      • canvas

        public static Image canvas(int width,
           int height,
           Color color,
           double alpha)
        Returns a blank image filled with the specified color, and with the specified opacity.

        The result is serializable.

        Parameters:
        width - the width of the canvas. Must be positive.
        height - the height of the canvas. Must be positive.
        color - the color to fill the canvas with
        alpha - the opacity of the canvas. 1 is for fully opaque, 0 is for transparent. Must be in [0, 1]

      • load

        public static Image load(File source)
                  throws IOException
        Loads an image from an image file. Accepted formats are JPEG, PNG, BMP, WBMP, and GIF.
        Parameters:
        source - the file to load the image from
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs during loading
        See Also:
        load(URL)

      • load

        public static Image load(URL source)
                  throws IOException
        Loads an image from the image file at the given URL. Accepted formats are JPEG, PNG, BMP, WBMP, and GIF.

        Use this method to load an image from a Java resource. Example: 

        Images.load(MyClass.class.getResource("resource.png"))

        Parameters:
        source - the URL to load the image from
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs during loading
        See Also:
        load(File)

      • forJavaImage

        public static Image forJavaImage(Image javaIm)
        Converts a Java image to an image. Ensures that all the pixels in the image are loaded before returning.
        Parameters:
        javaIm - a Java image
        Returns:
        an image that is equivalent to the given Java image

      • draw

        public static void draw(Image im,
        BufferedImage out,
        int x,
        int y)
        Draws the image on the given Java buffered image, at the specified position. Transparent pixels are copied as-is, which simply means that the image is not drawn "on top" of the Java buffered image.

        The image is first rasterized and anti-aliased using supersampling.

        Parameters:
        im - the image to draw
        out - the Java buffered image, to draw the image on
        x - the x-coordinate in the Java buffered image
        y - the y-coordinate in the Java buffered image

      • show

        public static void show(Image im)
        Shows the image in a new pop-up window. The background color (for transparent pixels) is white.
        Parameters:
        im - the image to show
        See Also:
        show(Image, Color)

      • show

        public static void show(Image im,
        Color backgroundColor)
        Shows the image in a new pop-up window. This method lets you specify a background color for transparent pixels.
        Parameters:
        im - the image to show

      • save

        public static void save(Image im,
        File out)
                 throws IOException
        Writes the image to the specified file. The format used is the result of bestFormat(com.projetloki.genesis.image.Image)
        Parameters:
        im - the image to save
        out - the file to write the image to
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs during writing
        See Also:
        save(Image, File, ImageFormat)

      • save

        public static void save(Image im,
        File out,
        ImageFormat format)
                 throws IOException
        Writes the image to the specified file in the specified format.
        Parameters:
        im - the image to save
        out - the file to write the image to
        format - the format in which to save the image
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs during writing
        See Also:
        save(Image, File)

      • bestFormat

        public static ImageFormat bestFormat(Image im)
        Tries to infer the best format in which to save the image. This method will return ImageFormat.JPEG if the image was originally loaded from a JPEG source, and PNG in all other cases.
        Parameters:
        im - the image to save
        Returns:
        the supposed best format in which to save the image
